Interface EditorStateManager

All Superinterfaces:
EditorState
All Known Implementing Classes:
BusinessEditorState
public interface EditorStateManager extends EditorState
Manages the state of the editor, providing methods to handle transitions between different states. This interface extends EditorState, allowing for additional state management behaviors to be implemented by the application.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    onFilterAdded()
    Updates the state of the editor to reflect that a filter has been added.
    void
    onFilterProcessed()
    Updates the state of the editor to reflect that a filter has been processed.
    void
    onFiltersRemoved()
    Updates the state of the editor to reflect that all filters have been removed.
    void
    onImageLoaded()
    Updates the state of the editor to reflect that an image has been successfully loaded.
    void
    onLoading()
    Updates the state of the editor to reflect that a loading operation is in progress.
    void
    onLoadingError()
    Updates the state of the editor to reflect that an error occurred during a loading operation.

    Methods inherited from interface ch.supsi.business.state.EditorState

    areChangesPending, canAddFilter, canApplyFilters, canExport, canSave, canSaveAs, isRefreshRequired
